title: I'm jumping on the Dynamic Queue hate.
body: Team Builder, had TONS of fun. Didn't mind waiting, got a bunch of solos, good stuff. Dynamic queue? Good luck. Well you win Riot. I will no longer play this game unless friends are with me. You. Fucking. Win.

replies.body:
Dynamic Queue itself isn't terrible, it's a perfect way for friends to queue together and enjoy themselves.

...It's the lack of alternatives for those who want to play solo (and there are a variety of reasons for that). Players can't hate something for not being there, so they decide to hate the only option they can: Dynamic Queue

Side Note: Dynamic Queue has no place in ranked, it's just another reason to add solo queue back

> ...It's the lack of alternatives for those who **want** to play solo

Ot those who want to play together but friends or collegues don't play LoL in general...

IF your MMR wasn't affected by dynamic queue, I'd wholeheartedly agree. As a solo queue player, I enjoy the challenge of going up against 4 or 5 man pre-mades, makes me stop and think about what I'm doing in the game. However, the fact that my MMR tanks just the same when I lose a game against a 4 or 5 man pre-made as compared to a game where there are only solo or duo queue'd players is absolutely asinine. That being said, something needs to be done about this, it's being exploited by enough players to where us solo queue players are getting the shaft for it.

Never have had a problem with anything Riot has implemented in the last 4 years, but holy moley I hope this problem is brought forth soon.
It's the forcing and shoving dynamic queue down everyone's throat that makes it bad. I wish there's a way you can indicate you don't mind being queued up with premades.

"Dynamic queue" is the ability to queue up as 3 or more for ranked.  We could already do this in normals.  Saying you support DQ, but then saying it has no place in ranked, when it only exists in ranked, is a bit confusing.
did you just say dynamic Q only exists in ranked?{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-popcorn}}
Yup.  That's all it is.  We've been queueing with 3/4/5 man premades in normals for a looooong time. Lol.  This new DQ is ranked and ranked only.

Oh shit....you're serious? I mean you have no idea that the dynamic queue is being used in normal and ranked...like legit?!

{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
I'm assuming you're one of those idiots who confuse new champ select with dynamic queue.

Is this conversation actually happening? Tell me this is some deranged lasagna induced nightmare where i am accosted by countless morons...solo Q is dead in all its forms. Champion select is not the same as the Q or matchmaking system...i am aware of that. Normal Q uses dynamic Q...there is only dynamic Q...Riot said it...we live it... Blind pick may be the only non dynamic Q in existence...but even if so, it doesnt count as a game mode.

feel free to call me idiot again if it makes you feel better, but it wont bring solo Q back. Say your last words and start the grieving process...its dead and not coming back.
Dynamic queue, according to Riot, is the ability to queue up as any number of players in ranked.  Maybe they are wrong though.

yeah..and its being used in unranked summoners rift also.

> when it only exists in ranked, 


this is why were talking....are you just hitting random keys or do you know what youre saying?
i 'spose you know more than Riot.

i can see this is isnt going anywhere...ask riot support. the dynamic q system is in use in normal mode summoners rift. 

end of discussion
(shrug) I can't force you to be right.

You don't know who does and does not enjoy it.  When someone doesn't like something they tend to voice it through anger or reason right? 

When you are satisfied, you move along with your day.

The truth is, there is really no way to tell if players truly favor one over the other 
The community among the boards heavily favor SQ, that much is obvious, but it's hardly representative of the league community. Not only does the boards not represent even 1/4 of the league community, but it's also limited to almost all NA/EUW players as well

I made this thread in an attempt to rectify that very issue:
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/p3lZpe6J-a-simple-poll

you can casually play with your friends as "dynamicq" or better said "premades between 1 to 5" in:
Bot Beginner games
Bot Intermediate games
Normal Summoner Rift games
Draft Summoner Rift games
Aram games
3v3 games
Custom games
"Fun game modes" games

Where was the only place where you couldn't premade as 5?
Ranked games
What did "Dinaymicq" REALLY do?
Simply, add "ranked games" into the list of premade between 1 and 5.

So, judging from all these facts. And how you could already "play with as many friends as you want" in ALL game modes barring ranked mode. We can arrive to the conclusion that nothing really matters anymore. The only option for solo players to face mostly solo players is gone.

> [{quoted}](name=OMG halp meh plz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=alQtBy8Y,comment-id=000d,timestamp=2016-04-14T09:45:57.426+0000)
>
> I don't understand why solo MMR and party MMR are the same if they're allowed in ranked.
> 
> Dota 2 has them separated.

Simple.

Because if (or actually when, because I believe it's inevitable) they do that everyone will compare and rank themselves only by the solo MMR (which is of course the way to go).

So there goes all attention away from the dynamic Q "play with friends" mentality Riot is shoving down our throats.

Riot knows the majority of players has a competitive side to them. They will compare their ranks with others. But there are so many bad players that get butthurt by their rank so Riot gave them a way of getting boosted aka "playing with friends" without violating ToS.

Now they can show off their rank without having someone judge them that they haven't acquired the rank by themselves.

Is it just me or are people confusing dynamic queue with the new champ select? That's not the same, dynamic queue is the ability to play ranked "solo" queue with friends, while champ select is well the new champ select, so comparing team builder to dynamic queue is like apples and oranges.

Riot made sure this would happen by only talking about New Champ Select in conjunction with Dynamic Queue. They roll all the stats together and foster the confusion so that when they do their polls/surveys, they can get a bunch of fabricated data showing how the "majority" of the playerbase thinks DQ is good for the game and should be endorsed over all other alternatives. It sounds tinfoily, to be sure, but they've done the same sort of thing so many other times before -- Karma, for example. I'm not going to explain that one here unless you're curious since that's not what this thread is about.

But yeah, Riot makes sure there are enough players who don't know the difference between the systems so they can drag out charts and data that "prove" they're doing what the players want.

From my limited experience of Ranked this season, if feels more like normals with "consequences" than proper ranked. It either doesn't feel like it is worth the investment of time, or people are just playing like it is normals.

Dude! Thank you. Normals with consequences is perfect. I came back during preseason and played mainly ranked and felt like it was normals with benefits. Dynamic is the exact opposite, you gave me the perfect term for it.

Playing against people getting boosted or having premade trolls in my team is always great.

Can someone please explain how Dynamic queue has ruined Ranked play? I am currently low Plat and I have yet to have a single game ruined by an enemy premade. Sometimes I may see two, or in rare cases three, people with the same club tag and assume it's a premade but those games are rarely unwinnable stomps by the enemy team, nor has my experienced been negatively impacted by those rare cases. I only ever play Ranked by myself and the vast majority of the players I am grouped with and face are similarly "solo queue".

I understand from watching streamers that this is not the case at high elo, and this certainly makes sense. But then why are the vocal minority crying about it on the boards? I'm willing to bet that most people posting in these threads are not super high elo players, and given my own personal experiences I am sensing a very large disconnect between the expectation and the reality. Is this some rampant problem in bronze - gold? Am I missing something?

Dynamic queue and teambuilder are unrelated. Dynamic queue is queing up with 1-5 people. You are thinking of new champ select.
you would think that, but dynamic queue is queueing with roles. if they were to release solo queue, it would be called dynamic solo queue.

no, that is the new queue, dynamic queue is not being able to select your role. Pretty sure this has already been stated in multiple other threads.
Edit: here is a quote by riot that is very recent in the new announcement "we believe that dynamic queue is closer to representing a healthy, competitive landscape in League of Legends than solo/duo queue. We’re not saying this to present a binary ‘one or the other’ situation"

think you're about halfway there friend.

the new queue, dynamic queue, is selecting your role, and is also currently playing with friends.

solo/duo queue was to not select roles in queue, but just a basic queue. the queue was set up differently, and did not feature the role selection.

and you see, some people want that back as well, but again, like i need to say to everyone that want's solo it's a bad idea, at this point if we get solo it would be terrible, splitting the community, causing higher queue times, lowering styles, also because let's be real here people that play solo are going to push for more rewards because they feel like they deserve it more because they played solo.

just because a lot of threads use a term and describe a term in a similar fashion does not mean that they are right. honestly the reason why there are so many threads is because of a mix of confusion, butthurt, and refusal to change, while also trying to blame everything away like they probably do every game.
